== Welcome! ==

PNWTeam is the Ubuntu user group for the Pacific Northwest region of the United States.  If you haven't found a local community (loco) team to call home yet please feel free to jump in and help out.

If you're interested in learning more about the team and what's going on please consider joining our <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-us-pnw|mailing list]]</nowiki> or visit our <nowiki>[[http://pnw.ubuntu-us.org/forum|forum]]</nowiki>! 

== Goals ==
* Become an Official Ubuntu Local Community Team (<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/PNWTeam/ApprovalApplication|Approval Application]]</nowiki>)
* Spread Ubuntu Linux through out the Pacific Northwest
* Provide assistance with migrating, installing, configuring, and using Ubuntu
* Promote the Ubuntu Certification
* Work with other groups to improve the computing experience by increasing awareness as well as improving software and documentation

== What's Happening ==
* Events:
** <nowiki>[[http://gslug.org/|Greater Seattle Linux User's Group]]</nowiki> - Usually the second Saturday of each month
** <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/PNWTeam/Meetings/CurrentAgenda|Next Team Meeting]]</nowiki> - (8th of May 2008 at 6:00 PM PST)
** <nowiki>[[http://wiki.ubuntu.com/PNWTeam/projects/LFNW2008|LinuxFest Northwest 2008]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/PNWTeam/projects|Team Projects]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/PNWTeam/Directory|Team Wiki Directory]]</nowiki>

== How to Join ==
As we look forward to any contributions you can make, the team has taken a little extra time to gather the information to help you get started.  We ask that everyone who would like to be a member of the PNW Team read the latest version of the  <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/codeofconduct/|Code of Conduct]]</nowiki> (CoC) then sign <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/codeofconduct/1.0.1/+sign|sign the agreement]]</nowiki> before joining.

We ask that you seal the deal so to speak because the CoC is the foundation of Ubuntu development.  Signing the CoC means that you will have to  <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/people/dshufelt/+login|register with Launchpad and create an account]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/GnuPrivacyGuardHowto|generate and upload a GnuPG key]]</nowiki>.  Think of Launchpad is the vehicle used by Ubuntu to track and collaborate on projects.  Please contact a team member if you need additional assistance signing the CoC. 

Now you need to <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UserPreferences|Login to https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UserPreferences]]</nowiki> using your Launchpad username and password.  Fill out the User Preferences with the desired information.  Donâ€™t forget to add PNWTeam to the Subscribed wiki pages list then click Save.

Join our mailing list by visiting <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-us-pnw]]</nowiki>

Last but not certainly not least add your name, team position (if any), location, and contact information to the members list table below (or <nowiki>[[mailto:dshufelt@gmail.com|email me]]</nowiki>).

Feel free to correct any mistakes that may have been made in this process.

== Suggestions ==
Please feel free to email us at ubuntu-us-pnw@lists.ubuntu.com with any idea's you may have.
